messages.subject: re: food, long
messages.msgSnippet: ***I see your point, but no.  I really don t think my kids would like coffee, or whole cow s milk, or white bread, etc. (just examples that I can think of off
messages.messageBody:
***I see your point, but no. I really don't think my kids would like
coffee, or whole cow's milk, or white bread, etc. (just examples that I
can think of off the top of my head).***

One of my sons *loves* coffee with lots of whole milk and sugar. And they all love white bread, preferably with turkey or something in the middle or made into french toast.

***Why would they like them? I
don't.***

You honestly don't think your children will like something just because *you* don't? All three of my children like apples, and I can't stand them! I'm allergic, actually.

***And, chances are, without
social forces to help them like bad things, they probably never will***

I don't think my kids like the things they like because of "social forces," I think they like the things they like because they think they taste good.

They think white bread and whole milk taste good, and they also think that carrots, broccoli, and watermelon taste good. They manage to achieve a balance all on their own.

Patti
